snippet: A $1.5 billion project that promises to build a school and affordable housing has run up against opposition at a time when high-rise development seems to be proceeding unchecked in Manhattan.
abstract: Redevelopment of Manhattan's historic South Street Seaport has stalled, despite ongoing negotiations between Howard Hughes Corp and city's Economic Development Corporation; developer's plan for condominium tower has ignited resistance, with many expressing fear structure would block views of Brooklyn Bridge, and de Blasio administration continues to push for project to include 80,000 new units of affordable housing.
lead_paragraph: A $1.5 billion project that promises to build a school and affordable housing has run up against opposition at a time when high-rise development seems to be proceeding unchecked in Manhattan.

headline.main: Despite Amenities, South Street Seaport Redevelopment Plans Stall Over a High-Rise
headline.print_headline: Despite Amenities, Seaport Redevelopment Project Stalls Over a High-Rise
